plugins.name: Accessibility Checker
plugins.description:
Make your designs accessible to everyone with this comprehensive accessibility checker. This plugin combines automated testing with guided manual review to ensure your designs meet accessibility standards.


🔍 AUTOMATED CHECKS

- Text contrast analysis against backgrounds

- Font size verification for readability

- Overlapping elements detection

- Missing alt text detection


✅ INTERACTIVE CHECKLIST

Track your progress with a persistent checklist covering key accessibility criteria:

- Contrast and readability

- Color usage and clarity

- Image descriptions and alt text

- Language simplicity

- Animation limits

- Overall design clarity


💡 EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES

Each accessibility issue includes a direct link to relevant WCAG guidelines and best practices to help you learn while you design.


Perfect for designers who want to create more inclusive products and ensure compliance with accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1). This plugin makes accessibility checking a seamless part of your design workflow rather than an afterthought.


Whether you're new to accessibility or an experienced designer, this tool helps you identify and fix issues early in the design process, saving development time and creating better experiences for all users.
plugins.tagline: Create accessible designs with automated checks and guided review

plugins.name: Schemator
plugins.description:
Schemator provides a flexible schema for your components helping you build code connect and write further tooling on it.


  1. Consistent Naming - Establish a universal schema for component properties, promoting seamless collaboration and code integration across teams and projects.
  2. Predictable Structure - Adopt a familiar and logical naming convention, ensuring that components are intuitive to use and easy to extend.
  3. Sanitized Definitions - Enable customization by adding suffixes and prefixes to property definitions, giving developers the flexibility to tailor components to their specific workflows.


Schemator is full open sourced, feel free to make changes to the rules and logic as you like 😀
plugins.tagline: Strucutre schema of your Figma components

plugins.name: tokenXtractor - by techworks studio
plugins.description:
tokenXtractor is a Figma plugin thoughtfully crafted to make exporting local variables, or tokens, easy and accessible. Its usage is fairly straightforward: configure your options, select your collections, and then download them.


1) Configure your options


  1. Case Style
  2. Export Single File
  3. Export Format


2) Select your collections


All collections are selected by default, so if you would like to export all your collections, you can skip this step. Otherwise, click on the variable collection name to select / deselect it for export.You can select multiple using CMD + Click (MacOS) or CTRL + Click (Windows). To select a range, click the first collection and then SHIFT + Click the last collection.You can undo your selection by clicking the 'RESET' button next to 'Collections?'


3) Download your tokens


Finally, press the 'DOWNLOAD TOKENS' button, save the zip file where you'd like, and then unzip the file to access your exported tokens.


Previewing + Misc. Tips


The right half of the plugin contains a 'preview' of the tokens to be exported. When exporting multiple files, you can use the dropdown menu next to 'Previewing' to switch the collection you're viewing.


------------------------------

Brought to you by techworks.studio

------------------------------
plugins.tagline: Export local variables to code-ready files

plugins.name: Vertical Trim Cap Height Scanner
plugins.description:
This plugin makes it easy to find text that has had "Cap Height to baseline" vertical trim applied with the click of a button.

It's a useful tool to find and fix incorrectly applied text trims.


How to use:

  1. Click the button on the page you want to search.
  2. Click on trimmed text to select it and modify manually.
  3. Click the button again to confirm the text no longer appears in results.


Tips for fixes:

  1. Be careful when changing trim settings to "Standard" as it may cause layout shifts.
  2. Start by fixing text with the "Main component" tag first.


日本語訳

ボタンをクリックするだけで、上下トリミングに「ベースラインまでのキャップハイト」が設定されているテキストを見つけることができます。

誤って上下トリミングを設定してしまった時に便利なツールです。


使い方：

  1. 検索したいページでボタンをクリックします。
  2. トリミングが設定されたテキストをクリックし、手動で修正します。
  3. 再度ボタンをクリックし、検索結果に表示されなくなったことを確認します。


修正時のコツ：

  1. トリミングを標準に変更するとレイアウトシフトが発生するので、慎重に修正しましょう。
  2. 「メインコンポーネント」タグのついたテキストから先に修正するのがおすすめです。
plugins.tagline: Search for text with "Cap height to baseline" set for vertical trim

plugins.name: Combine Pages
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin built for designers who value organization just as much as iteration.


Whether you're wrapping up a sprint, handing off files, or simply cleaning house, Archive & Combine Pages helps you bring order to your design file with ease. Select any number of pages, and this plugin will neatly group their content into a single new page titled Archive [date]. Each page’s content is preserved as a section, spaced evenly and grouped for clarity. Once processed, original pages are renamed with an ARCHIVED_ prefix — so nothing gets lost, but everything gets tidied.

plugins.name: Figma Frame History
plugins.description:
This tool enables version-controlled frame history management directly on the page. It offers four key commands:


• Major Version: Select a BASE NODE on the page and execute this command. A NEW NODE will be created right after the BASE NODE, with a version control suffix in its name (e.g., Frame_1.0 → Frame_v2.0).


• Minor Version: Similar to the **Major Version** command, but only the minor version number is incremented by 1 (e.g., Frame_1.0 → Frame_v1.1).


• Unlock History: This command unlocks all previously locked frames in the history, restoring them to their default style.


• Lock History: This command locks all history frames again, making them transparent.


If the BASE NODE name does not include a version control suffix _${majorVersion}.${minorVersion}, the NEW NODE name will default to ${baseNodeName}_v1.0 when either the Major Version or Minor Version command is executed.

accepted.name: RyanHuang 👀
accepted.description:
🔸 Product Designer
🔸 Heavy user of Figma
🔸 Beginner in FE

plugins.tagline: A frame history management tool for creating and organizing frame versions directly on the page

plugins.name: Frontify Template Checker
plugins.description:
This plugin checks your Figma designs and highlights potential issues before uploading them as templates into Frontify. It’s designed to improve your template creation and management experience — making the integration between Figma and Frontify more seamless.


Issues

We’re continuously refining and expanding the list of checks. This initial release focuses on the most common issues, with more to come. As we improve template import capabilities, some checks may also be retired.


  1. Auto-layout frames
  2. Layers with multiple fills
  3. Frames with image fills
  4. Text case transformations
  5. Image filters
  6. Mixed text styles within a single text element
  7. Unsupported elements
  8. Empty pages
  9. Slice layers
  10. Flip transformations
  11. OpenType features
  12. Hanging punctuation


Support

If you come across issues not currently covered by the plugin, please contact your Customer Success Manager or email us at support@frontify.com.

plugins.name: Figma to Cape Template Designer
plugins.description:
Seamlessly Copy Figma Designs to Template Designer


🚀 Copy layers and frames from Figma directly into Template Designer.

🎨 Save time by avoiding manual recreation—copy, paste, and edit instantly.

⚡ Keep your workflow fast and efficient, focusing on design instead of tedious adjustments.

🔄 Easily update and edit imported layers, plus create unlimited formats.


Perfect for designers who want to work smarter. ✨


How to Use the Plugin

1 Select a frame or layer in Figma and click “Copy” in the plugin.

2 Open Template Designer and paste with ⌘V (or Ctrl + V on Windows).

3 Edit, update, and create multiple formats effortlessly!


Features

✅ Save Time & Work Efficiently

Skip the hassle of recreating designs—copy from Figma and start building immediately.

✅ Editable Layers

Make changes to text, images, and more within Template Designer.

✅ Unlimited Formats

Create multiple formats from a single design.

⚠️ Keep in Mind

Some advanced Figma styling elements may not be fully supported.


What is Template Designer?

Template Designer is part of Campaign Designer from Cape, a powerful tool for creating templates that generate multiple creatives. Designers can set up dynamic layers, allowing campaign managers to edit text, images and many more elements easily—making creative production faster and more scalable.


FAQ

What can I do with the plugin?

Quickly transfer your Figma designs into Template Designer without losing time on manual recreation.


Can I edit designs after pasting them?

Yes! You can edit imported layers, adjust elements, and create different formats.


Which elements are supported?

Most Figma layers, including text, shapes, and images. Some advanced styling may not be fully compatible.


What if I encounter an issue?

Let us know at Cape Support—we’re happy to help! ⚡️


This plugin helps designers work faster, update designs easily, and create scalable templates. Try it now and boost your workflow! 🚀
plugins.tagline: Transform Figma Designs into Template Designer templates

plugins.name: Copy Paste Overrides
plugins.description: A tiny tool that does exactly as described. Useful when working with nested instances. Let's say you have a component that contains a list of items. You are working in an instance of that component and want to switch item 1 with item 2 on the list. You cannot do that because reordering of items is not supported within an instance. But what you can do is just copy and paste the overrides from item 1 to item 2 and vice versa. You're welcome!

plugins.name: UX Buddy - AI powered pair designer
plugins.description:
UX Buddy is your AI-powered design partner, built to streamline your UX workflow and enhance your design process within Figma.


  1. Uncover Assumptions: Identify and challenge underlying assumptions in your designs.
  2. Discover Edge Cases: Proactively find potential error states and unusual user interactions.
  3. Evaluate Usability: Get AI-driven feedback on the usability of your selected layers based on established heuristics.
  4. Check Accessibility: Perform quick accessibility checks, considering WCAG guidelines for aspects like color contrast and more.
  5. Contextual Analysis: Provide persona details, research insights, and other context to get more tailored feedback from your AI Buddy.
  6. Flexible AI Providers: Connect to various AI services including OpenAI, GroqCloud, Hugging Face, or your local Ollama instance.
  7. Customizable Prompts: Tailor UX Buddy to your specific needs by creating and managing your own prompt library.


Whether you're brainstorming, refining user flows, or conducting detailed evaluations, UX Buddy acts as an intelligent assistant, helping you make more informed design decisions and create better user experiences, faster.


--------

How to set up AI Provider:


☁️ Option 1: Cloud APIs (OpenAI, GroqCloud, Hugging Face)


Use cloud-based AI models by connecting to one of these supported services.

  1. Select “Cloud API”.
  2. Choose your service (OpenAI, GroqCloud, or Hugging Face) from the dropdown.
  3. Enter your credentials:
  4. OpenAI: API Key from platform.openai.com
  5. ⚠️ Important: OpenAI requires a funded account to use the API. Free trial credits may be available, but ongoing usage requires a billing setup.
  6. GroqCloud: API Key from console.groq.com
  7. Hugging Face: Access Token from huggingface.co/settings/tokens
  8. Enter the Model Name : choose a vision-capable model:
  9. OpenAI: e.g., gpt-4o, gpt-4-vision-preview
  10. GroqCloud: e.g., meta-llama/llama-4-scout-17b-16e-instruct
  11. Hugging Face: e.g., google/gemma-3-27b-it
  12. Click “Test Current AI Connection” to verify everything works.


-----

💻 Option 2: Ollama (Local AI)


Use Ollama to run models locally on your machine—no internet required once models are downloaded.


🔧 Prerequisites:

  1. Install Ollama: Download it from ollama.com.
  2. Run Ollama:
  3. Launch Ollama via terminal (ollama serve) or the desktop app.
  4. For convenience, you can set it up to run in the background automatically:
  5. macOS: via a plist launch agent
  6. Linux: via a systemd service (Note: These are part of your system configuration and not managed by UX Buddy.)
  7. Download Your Model:
  8. Use ollama pull llava or another vision-enabled model.
  9. Ensure the model supports your desired functionality (e.g., image analysis).


🛠️ Configuration in UX Buddy:

  1. Select “Ollama” as your provider.
  2. Enter your API Base URL — usually http://localhost:11434.
  3. Enter the Model Name (e.g., llava, llama3, etc.).
  4. Click “Test Current AI Connection”.
plugins.tagline: Your AI-powered UX design partner.

135327.name: UX Buddy - AI powered pair designer
135327.description:

  1. Uncover Assumptions: Identify and challenge underlying assumptions in your designs.
  2. Discover Edge Cases: Proactively find potential error states and unusual user interactions.
  3. Evaluate Usability: Get AI-driven feedback on the usability of your selected layers based on established heuristics.
  4. Check Accessibility: Perform quick accessibility checks, considering WCAG guidelines for aspects like color contrast and more.
  5. Contextual Analysis: Provide persona details, research insights, and other context to get more tailored feedback from your AI Buddy.
  6. Flexible AI Providers: Connect to various AI services including OpenAI, GroqCloud, Hugging Face, or your local Ollama instance.
  7. Customizable Prompts: Tailor UX Buddy to your specific needs by creating and managing your own prompt library.


Whether you're brainstorming, refining user flows, or conducting detailed evaluations, UX Buddy acts as an intelligent assistant, helping you make more informed design decisions and create better user experiences, faster.


--------

How to set up AI Provider:


☁️ Option 1: Cloud APIs (OpenAI, GroqCloud, Hugging Face)


Use cloud-based AI models by connecting to one of these supported services.

  1. Select “Cloud API”.
  2. Choose your service (OpenAI, GroqCloud, or Hugging Face) from the dropdown.
  3. Enter your credentials:
  4. OpenAI: API Key from platform.openai.com
  5. ⚠️ Important: OpenAI requires a funded account to use the API. Free trial credits may be available, but ongoing usage requires a billing setup.
  6. GroqCloud: API Key from console.groq.com
  7. Hugging Face: Access Token from huggingface.co/settings/tokens
  8. Enter the Model Name : choose a vision-capable model:
  9. OpenAI: e.g., gpt-4o, gpt-4-vision-preview
  10. GroqCloud: e.g., meta-llama/llama-4-scout-17b-16e-instruct
  11. Hugging Face: e.g., google/gemma-3-27b-it
  12. Click “Test Current AI Connection” to verify everything works.


-----

💻 Option 2: Ollama (Local AI)


Use Ollama to run models locally on your machine—no internet required once models are downloaded.


🔧 Prerequisites:

  1. Install Ollama: Download it from ollama.com.
  2. Run Ollama:
  3. Launch Ollama via terminal (ollama serve) or the desktop app.
  4. For convenience, you can set it up to run in the background automatically:
  5. macOS: via a plist launch agent
  6. Linux: via a systemd service (Note: These are part of your system configuration and not managed by UX Buddy.)
  7. Download Your Model:
  8. Use ollama pull llava or another vision-enabled model.
  9. Ensure the model supports your desired functionality (e.g., image analysis).


🛠️ Configuration in UX Buddy:

  1. Select “Ollama” as your provider.
  2. Enter your API Base URL — usually http://localhost:11434.
  3. Enter the Model Name (e.g., llava, llama3, etc.).
  4. Click “Test Current AI Connection”.

plugins.name: Figma variables to Penpot tokens by Detachless
plugins.description:
Figma variables to Penpot tokens by Detachless

This plugin bridges the gap between Figma's design system variables and Penpot's design tokens, allowing seamless migration of your local variables.


How It Works

The plugin connects to Figma's Variables API to extract local variable collections and transform them into Penpot's token format. Here's the process:


  1. Collection Discovery: Upon launch, the plugin scans your Figma file for all variable collections and presents them in a selectable list.
  2. Intelligent Mapping: The converter handles various Figma variable types (colors, numbers, strings, booleans) and maps them to Penpot's token system, including:
  3. Variable mode conversion to Penpot themes
  4. Proper handling of variable references
  5. Special formatting of colors (HEX and RGBA)
  6. Nested structure preservation
  7. Token Organization: The plugin creates a structured Penpot token JSON with:
  8. Themes based on your variable collections and modes
  9. Proper metadata for Penpot compatibility
  10. Dependency management between collections
  11. Clean Output: The result is a downloadable JSON file ready to be imported into Penpot's design system.


Something is not working or you have suggestion for new feature? Submit feedback


🎉 Bonus: Publish your designs directly to websites with Detachless – no coding needed! 💻🌐

plugins.name: Sync Variables with Notion
plugins.description:
Synchronizes variables from a Notion database to a Figma document's Variable Collection. This is particularly useful for managing application text in Notion or supporting multiple languages.


🔥 How to use


Sync collection tab

Connects a Notion database to a Figma Variable Collection and synchronizes their values. Settings are saved per Figma document.


1. Database ID

Specify the Notion database ID (Reference).


2. Integration token

First, create a new integration in Notion (Reference). Next, grant your integration page permissions (Reference). Enter the copied token.


3. Key property name

Specify the name of the Notion property that serves as the unique key for the variables (e.g., Name, Key, ID). Currently, title, formula, and text properties are supported as keys.


4. Collection name to create or update

Specify the name of the Figma Variable Collection to sync with. Existing local collection names will be suggested via autocomplete. If the specified collection doesn't exist, it will be created.


5. Add or reorder modes

Specify the Notion property names that correspond to Figma Variable Modes. These properties will hold the variable values for each mode (e.g., language).


  1. Adding modes:
  2. Enter a mode name in the textbox (e.g., ja, en, or other property names in your Notion database).
  3. Click the "Add" button to add it to the list.
  4. Reordering modes: Modes in the list can be reordered via drag and drop. This order will be reflected in the order of Figma variable modes.
  5. Removing modes: Click the X icon to the right of each mode name to remove that mode from the list.


After entering the information for steps 1-4, click the "Sync variable collection with Notion" button to start the synchronization. This process might take some time depending on the number of items in the database and the variables.


List tab

About list tab

Displays variables from the selected Collection. Only STRING type variables applicable to TEXT_CONTENT are shown. You can copy keys and values, and filter the list by key or value. Clicking on a row reveals the button described below.


"Apply variable to selected text" button

Select text layers in Figma and click the button to apply the variable.


Display mode

Select the Variable Mode (e.g., language) to display its corresponding values in the list.


About caching

When the target collection is a library collection, this plugin caches its information in client storage. This is done because fetching library collections with many variables can be time-consuming and might hit Figma's API rate limits. Clicking the "Refresh" button clears the cache and fetches the latest variable data.


Utilities tab

Provides several utility actions to help manage variables and their application to text layers.


Target collection

Select the Variable Collection to target for the actions. You can choose a collection or all collections.


Target text range

Select the scope for the actions: "Selection", "Current page", or "All pages". You can also choose whether to include text layers within components ("Include text within components") or instances ("Include text within instances") using the respective checkboxes.


Limit variable name

Optionally, enter text here to limit the "Bulk apply variables" action to only those variables whose names contain the specified text.


"Bulk apply variables" button

Automatically applies variables to text layers within the selected range. It matches text content with variable values across all modes in the target collection(s).


"Highlight applied variables" button

Visualizes variable usage on text layers. Text layers with variables applied are highlighted in blue, while those without are highlighted in red.


📮 Support

If you have any problems or feedback, please use the GitHub Issues.


===


This plugin was created by Ryo Nakae 🙎‍♂️.


https://brdr.jp

https://x.com/ryo_dg

https://github.com/ryonakae
plugins.tagline: Sync text from Notion database to variable collection of Figma.

132062.release_notes:
- Refactored code to improve processing speed and stability
- Fixed an issue where caching would fail when selecting library collections with thousands of variables (now displays variable lists without caching)
- Implemented UI-level caching of library collection data while the plugin is running (this reduces API calls even when library collections cannot be cached in Client Storage)
- Various minor bug fixes and improvements

plugins.name: Calculator
plugins.description:
A handy Figma plugin designed to accelerate your workflow by instantly calculating totals from numerical values in text layers. Whether you're working on financial interfaces, data tables, or statistical visualizations, this tool ensures accuracy and efficiency with minimal effort.


How It Works:


Automatic Number Detection:

Quickly detects and extracts numbers from your selected text layers, effortlessly handling various formats:

  1. Simple numbers: 1234
  2. Decimal numbers: 1234.56 or 1234,56
  3. Numbers with thousand separators: 1,234.56 or 1.234,56


Real-Time Calculation:

Instantly calculates and displays the total sum of all detected numbers from your selected layers. Update your selection, and the total recalculates automatically.


Detailed View:

Offers an expandable detailed view showing each processed text layer along with its extracted numeric value, making it easy to verify and manage your data.


Key Features:


Real-Time Updates: Automatically refreshes calculations as your selection changes.

Adaptive Interface: Collapses the detailed view when no layers are selected, keeping your workspace clean.

Theme Support: Fully compatible with both light and dark Figma themes for optimal visibility.

Native Integration: Utilizes Figma’s native UI components for a seamless experience.


Who Is It For?


This plugin is ideal for designers who frequently handle numerical data within their designs. By automating the calculation process, it allows you to save valuable time and focus more on the creative aspects of your projects, enhancing productivity and accuracy.
plugins.tagline: Select text layers, instantly calculate their numerical values in real time.

127100.release_notes:
Enhanced Number Parsing:
Improved handling of thousand separators (1,000 and 1.000)
Better detection of decimal points vs thousand separators
Support for both European (1.234,56) and American (1,234.56) number formats
Currency Support:
Added recognition of currency symbols ($, €, £, ₴, ¥, ₿)
Support for currency codes (USD, EUR, GBP, UAH, JPY, BTC, ETH, USDT)
Handles currency notation at both start and end of numbers (e.g., "$1,000" and "1,000 USD")
Error Handling:
Added informative messages when no text layers are selected
Added feedback when no valid numeric values are found
127100.tagline: Select text layers, instantly calculate their numerical values in real time.

plugins.name: WCAG Contrast Checker|🔎 تحليل التباين وفقًا لـ WCAG
plugins.description:
في تجربة المستخدم، وضوح النصوص على الخلفيات يلعب دورًا أساسيًا في ضمان قراءة مريحة وسهلة للجميع، بما في ذلك الأشخاص ذوي الإعاقة البصرية. وهنا يأتي دور معايير WCAG التي تحدد نسبة التباين المثلى بين النص والخلفية.


💡 كيف يعمل البلغين؟

📌 حدد النص والخلفية داخل Figma، ثم اضغط على “تحليل التباين”. سيقوم البلغين بحساب نسبة التباين وإظهار تنبيه فوري يخبرك إن كان التباين متوافقًا أو غير متوافق وفقًا لمعايير WCAG.


✅ لماذا هذا مهم؟

✔️ يضمن وضوح النصوص وتحسين تجربة القراءة.

✔️ يساعد المصممين في تحقيق معايير إمكانية الوصول (Accessibility).

✔️ يختصر الوقت في اختبار الألوان داخل التصميم.
plugins.tagline: WCAG Contrast Checker|🔎 تحليل التباين وفقًا لـ WCAG

plugins.name: Variable JSON
plugins.description:
"Variable JSON – Seamlessly Export Figma Variables to JSON"


Quickly convert your Figma variables into clean JSON with Variable JSON. Select your Collection, Group, and Mode, generate the JSON, and copy it instantly—perfect for streamlining design-to-development workflows.


How to Use:

  1. Open Variable JSON: In Figma, go to Plugins > Variable JSON.
  2. Select Variables: Choose the Collection, Group, and Mode (e.g., Light, Dark, or Custom).
  3. Generate JSON: Click "GEN JSON" to create the JSON output based on your selection.
  4. Copy JSON: Click copy button and use it in your projects.


Effortless variable exporting starts here! 🚀
